All Games > Indie Games > Absconding Zatwor
Community Hub
Absconding Zatwor
Absconding Zatwor is a stealth 2D game where an innocent man, Randy Crow, is put in prison for a crime he did not commit. Your mission is to escape from Zatwor prison and prove his innocence.
User reviews: Mixed (258 reviews) - 54% of the 258 user reviews for this game are positive.
Release Date: Jul 6, 2015

About This Game

Randy Crow was an ordinary guy living an ordinary life. Nice family, 2 brothers, a dog... But then one night he went to the gas station to buy cigarettes and witnessed a brutal murder of a station cashier. By the time the police got there, it was already too late - the killer was long gone and Randy was the only guy around... That's when they took him and locked him up for good. The prison they took him to was Zatwor - the most brutal prison in the country. Aware of his innocence, Randy decided to run away! In his way is only the best security system in the world. Will you be his juror and help him in proving himself not guilty?
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows XP
    • Processor: Intel dual core 2.0 Ghz
    • Memory: 512 MB RAM
    • Graphics: Any
    • DirectX: Version 9.0c
    • Hard Drive: 500 MB available space
    • Sound Card: any
    Recommended:
    • OS: Windows 7
    • Processor: Intel dual core 2.0 Ghz
    • Memory: 512 MB RAM
    • Graphics: Any
    • DirectX: Version 11
    • Hard Drive: 500 MB available space
    • Sound Card: any

Borgo

1 review
Not Recommended
9.4 hrs on record
Posted: July 6
The game looks and feels like it was made in two days. Less of a puzzle and more of fast reactions with clumsy movement system. And the name of the prison is Zatwor??? Zatwor is literally the Bulgarian (and maybe Polish, not sure) word for prison, written with english letters...

EpicQuest Games
40 products in account
2 reviews
Not Recommended
0.2 hrs on record
Posted: July 6
I really disliked the mouse-driven movement controls. It seems like it was designed for a touchpad, as any game like this designed for PC would allow WASD or gamepad-controls over the player. Sound was bad and graphics subpar. Not worth the (small amount) of money. There are better f2p stealth games out there.
Read More
 
Was this review helpful? Yes No Funny
60 of 70 people (86%) found this review helpful
1 person found this review funny
Yaqoub il-Falkun Malti
14 products in account
9 reviews
Not Recommended
0.6 hrs on record
Posted: July 6
This game would have been a great, free flash game, or even better in the mobile market.
It amazes me that the developer couldn't be bothered with adding keyboard input. If the game was targeted for a mobile audience I would understand. But only using mouse input causes some frustrating problems.
When trying to navigate around cameras, movement by mouse isn't really good for precision, and I kept getting busted because of it.
The game gets boring fast, has several annoying bugs, nothing really special about the graphics, there are more games out there like this that are free.

In short, I wouldn't recommend buying this game.
Read More
